series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EDDY MEMORIAL MEET

abstract.p: Shenendehowa High School, Clifton Park, NY, wins girls title at Eddy Memorial interscholastic track and field meet (M)

block.p: Shenendehowa High School of Clifton Park, N.Y., upset Long Island's Uniondale to win the girls title yesterday in the 60th annual Eddy Memorial interscholastic meet at Union College in Schenectady, N.Y. Uniondale won the past two years, but Shenendehowa, scoring heavy in the field events, tallied 74 points to Uniondale's runner-up total of 62.

Shevon Stoddart of Uniondale was named the meet's most valuable performer. Stoddart, a junior, won the 400-meter hurdles in 1 minute 5.88 seconds and the long jump at 16 feet 11 inches. She also ran the first leg on her school's winning 4x400 relay (4:04.05).

Shenendehowa High School of Clifton Park, N.Y., upset Long Island's Uniondale to win the girls title yesterday in the 60th annual Eddy Memorial interscholastic meet at Union College in Schenectady, N.Y. Uniondale won the past two years, but Shenendehowa, scoring heavy in the field events, tallied 74 points to Uniondale's runner-up total of 62.

Shevon Stoddart of Uniondale was named the meet's most valuable performer. Stoddart, a junior, won the 400-meter hurdles in 1 minute 5.88 seconds and the long jump at 16 feet 11 inches. She also ran the first leg on her school's winning 4x400 relay (4:04.05).
Jatoya Moore of Uniondale won the 100 in 12.37 seconds and anchored the winning 4x100 relay (49.89 seconds).

Jason Jabut, a senior from Seton Catholic in Plattsburgh, N.Y., was selected the boys' most valuable performer. He took the mile run in 4:17.34 and the 800 in 1:51.99, the fastest time in New York State this season.
Colonie of Albany captured the boys 800 in 1:51.99, the fastest time in New York State this season.
Colonie of Albany captured the boys team title with 43 points. DeWitt Clinton of the Bronx finished in a tie for third at 34 points.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- EDDY MEMORIAL MEET
